alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 10:27AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Nebraska, including the following county, Dundy. * WHEN...Until noon MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 926 AM MDT, local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. Between 5 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. Multiple roads and bridges to the north and east of Benkelman are under water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Max. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
